b:
^King Khepri will be dead by nightfall if the rumours are to be believed...

^He embarks upon his nightly quest to carry the sun through the Netherworld so that it may rise again!

^But the citizens of Lunu are behaving strangely. Demons are stirring and Khepri must find out why...

s0: ^...Who are you and why are you narrating my journey?

Thoth: ^Will you join me on my travels?
^How can I talk to other characters and get them to join my party?
^How can I ask characters to leave my party?

c-0: ^I am Thoth, Scribe to the Gods.
^It is my destiny to carve your legend into the skies, never to be forgotten.
^I have embarked upon my nightly quest to carry the sun through the Netherworld, yet there are rumours of stirring demons and my impending death.  I must find companions to help me!
c-3: ^Select your character icon to access your inventory.
c-4:
^After each battle or quest, you gain experience.

^If you have enough experience, you will gain a level and have attribute points to spend.

^Spend them on attributes listed on your character sheet.

^You can access your character sheet by clicking on your character icon.
c-5:
^Select them to talk to them. You can ask some characters to join your party.

^Increase your charisma to increase their chance of joining you.
c-6: ^You can select the character icons to talk to them. You can then ask them to leave your party.
c-7:
^If you approach hostile creatures, you will engage them in battle.

^In the battle, you have action points which you can spend on movement or actions.

^Actions cost half of your total action points and will end your turn.

LeaveThoth: ^That's a shame. I'll be waiting here if you change your mind.
JoinThoth: ^It would be my greatest honour to join your party.

s0: ^ Your road is perilous this night!
s1: ^ Take care this night, my king!
s2: ^ Travel not to the Netherworld alone this night!

b: ^Khepri, Lord of the Rising Sun, heed my warning.
^Darkness will soon descend upon all of Lunu. The sea will glitter for the last time!
^A little scarab has thrust itself in my path, warning of the decent of endless darkness upon Lunu, my beloved land.

Child: ^I raise this sun every morning, my child. Why should this night be different?
^Silence! Who are you to warn a God?

c-2: ^Beware of those whom you most trust, sire!

Child2: ^I have heard tell of a traitor in your path!
^Someone you trust has joined the army of Apophis and plots against you. Find them!
^Am I to believe the concoctions of child? Be off with you.

c-0: ^The Spririt in the Sphynx whispers of your fate. Ask it and you will have your answer.
^There are whispers of betrayal. Could a trusted friend collude with the beasts of the Netherworld? Who could this 'friend' be? I must find the Spirit in the Sphynx to discover their identity.
^A treacherous denizen of Lunu is plotting to destroy you. Find them!

Skull: ^I have heard murmurs of a 'loyal' scarab who will plunge a dagger into my shell. Tell me all you know.
^What can I do for fun around here?

c-1: ^I weigh nothing, but you cannot hold me for long. What am I?
^Well guessed, Khepri... Here, have this imaginary medal.
c-2: ^Incorrect! One does not hold wind! Silly bug.

s0: ^I enjoy the crunch of passing scarabs. Delicious.
s1: ^I like to make the locals jump. Boo!
s2: ^ I like to tell a riddle or two.

s0: ^Or perhaps you would rather partake in battle with the local ruffians?
s1: ^Try talking to the locals. I hear some creatures enjoy... conversation.
s2: ^How about some retail therapy? There are delightful shops nearby.

c-3.#: A skull sparkles faintly in the sand

Skull2: ^Let us bargain, Khepri, Lord of the rising sun.
^I shall tell you a tale of betrayal, if you can answer me this.
^I live not, yet I grow. I breathe not, yet I need air. Drown me and I shall die. What am I?

c-0: ^A fool's answer. Begone before I swallow you whole.
^Find another way to locate the turncoat.
c-1: ^What? No. Are you the God of ignorance?
^Find another way to locate the traitor.
c-2: ^Lord Khepri, you are wiser than you appear. You shall have the answer you seek.
^A scarab will indeed betray you and serve your head to their Lord Apophis.
^You may find the traitor lurking in Upper Lunu.
^Here, have a potion to aid you on your journey.
^A sphynx has warned me of a scarab who lives in Upper Lunu. They are plotting to serve my head to their new Lord Apophis.

b: ^King of Scarabs, I have been praying for your arrival.

Father: ^We must part ways, Setna. Perhaps our paths will cross again.

s0: ^I have remembered a dream, will you tell me what it means?
s1: ^Interpret a dream for me, will you?

Father: ^I have the Amulet. Join me and we shall face the Netherworld's abominations together.
^Now that I feel the Amulet's power, I wish to keep it. I challenge you to a duel. (ATTACK)
^My time is short; I must depart.

c-3: ^I was outside, kneeling beside a corpse. When I examined the face, it was mine.
^I was gazing through a window, at the midday sun. The glare was painful to mine eyes.
^I was at my home, feeding seven monkeys.

c-0: ^Dreams are not always what they seem. This means you shall have a long life.
c-1: ^This is a good omen: Ra will hear your cries and grant you strength.
c-2: ^Be careful, my King. It means change. Perhaps a change of allegiances?
^Beware of a false friend who lives beyond Central Lunu.
^High Priest Setna has warned me of a false friend who lives beyond Central Lunu
c-3: ^Perhaps it will come back to you.

c-4: ^I have retrieved the amulet so that High Priest Setna might safely travel with me to the Netherworld, and retrieve his child.

c-6.#: I have it. And with it came despair. What bad omen are you, that my sun would be stolen so soon after we met? (ATTACK)

Father1: ^My daughter, Seesee, is missing. Will you help me find her?
^She read from the Scrolls of the Dead, then her soul rose up and vanished!
^High priest Setna has lost a daughter. Perhaps I can help?
^Why would she remove her soul from her body?
^But what can I do to help?
Underworld: ^I'n certain she has gone to the Netherworld.
PoorMan: ^Two funeral caskets had passed by, one of shabby cloth, and one encrusted with gems that glittered like stars!
^Seesee wished that upon my death I would share the fate of the poor scarab.
^I was insulted! But she wanted to prove me wrong.
^And now her poor soul is in the Netherworld to witness the judgement of the dead. I must find her!
^Perhaps the poor scarab's fate was richer after his death?
^You? Surely you know a mortal cannot enter the Netherworld and live?

c-0: ^I must see for myself and find my child!

Amulet: ^I need the Amulet of the Scarab to protect my mortal soul so I can enter that cursed land.
^If you retrieve it, I will join you, and we will fight the demons of the Netherworld together!
^I shall grant you your wish and retrieve the amulet.
^You dare bargain with me? Am I an errand-scarab or am I your God? (ATTACK)

c-0: ^You have my eternal gratitude, King of Scarabs and Lord of the rising sun!

^Seesee, the child of High Priest Setna, has ventured into the Netherworld alone. I must find the Amulet of the Scarab, so that Setna can travel to the Netherworld. The High Priest would be a great addition to my party.
c-1: ^Perhaps you are not worthy of my prayers after all.

Ammit: ^We must part ways. Perhaps our paths will cross again.
^We are in need of you, Ammut. Join my party
^Do you plot against me, old friend?
^Travel with me, my friend! Join my merry party!

c-2: ^I have confronted the traitor! My former ally has colluded with the beasts of the Netherworld. But what if more of my scarabs have joined the army of the dead?

b: ^Keeping me close, eh? Yes, I shall join you.
^I have found the traitor at last! But I will keep her close for now.
^Join you? When I will soon be Ammut, Devourer of Souls and have my own army? Never.

s0: ^I have seen beasts rise to the surface.
s1: ^The army of Apophis will soon outgrow the Netherworld.

AMMUTATTACK: ^Khepri, open your eyes! Lunu belongs to the Netherworld.
^Your severed head will please my master, Apophis!
^In the distraction of war, my sun has been stolen by Netherworld spirits! A veil of darkness will soon fall upon Lunu. I must find Mahef, the Ferrybug, and travel to the Netherworld at once!
^Your sun has been stolen! Ask Mahef the Ferrybug to help you find it!
Ambush: ^We shall be very merry in the Netherworld!

^I have fought demons disguised as scarabs, and won! But this battle was more bitter than sweet, for in the distraction of war, they have stolen my sun! I must find Mahef, the Ferrybug, and travel to the Netherworld at once!
^Your sun has been stolen! Ask Mahef the Ferrybug to help you find it!

s2: ^She strokes her necklace, a scarab carved of lapis lazuli

Meri: ^I do not want your miserable fruit, merchant. Have you knives? Have you spells?
^I see the Amulet of the Scarab hangs upon your neck. How much for it?
^The Ancient Alchemist's Potion of Charisma. Here, take it.

s1: ^Not now, perhaps I shall return later.

c-0:
^Ah! I had maces! I had knifes of the most splendid silver!

^Alas, dark spirits pilfered my crate of weapons this morning.

^May Sekhmet bless me with more stock!

s0: ^Of course! Do not mind the wasps, they merely add a little spice.
s1: ^ Take more than a sample, my Lord!
s2: ^ You will want a crateful once you have tried this.

c-4: ^Come again soon, I always have new stock!
^Do not forget to visit my tent, Meri's Shop of Merriments. It lies to the east.

AmuletQuest: ^This amulet is priceless...you cannot buy it. Not with gold at least.
^If you will not exchange it for gold, then what will you take?
^You deny me? You refuse the Lord of the setting sun, the King of Scarabs?
Fetch: ^...I will give you my amulet for a favour, my king.
^If I may be so bold as to ask...?
^Find me a special Potion of Charisma, one held by the Ancient Alchemist.

^A Merchant named Meri has asked me to find a special Potion of Charisma, held by the Ancient Alchemist. For this, she has promised me the Amulet of the Scarab. The Ancient Alchemist lives in the East.
^Is that all? A simple task. Consider it completed
^You could have asked for much more, my dear. You shall have your Potion of Charisma
Reason: ^Praise Ra! Soon I shall coat my tongue in silver and charm the fortune back into my little tent!
AncientCrone: ^You there! Remove yourself from my land.
^One moment of your time, Ancient Alchemist... I search for your Potion of Charisma

c-0: ^I have defeated an Ancient Alchemist. Now I must find Mari and give her the Ancient Alchemist's potion, in exchange for the Amulet of the Scarab.

c-0.#: Starting text/custom battle text: Stay away from my potions!
Ending text: As you cast the spell that strikes her down, the Ancient Crone vanishes into a dust of skin, and you have gained her potions of charisma. Meri the Merchant will be pleased.

AmuletQuestComplete: ^You have bruised your antennae! It was not such a simple task after all. May the sun spirits bless you.
^Here, take this potion as my tribute to you.
^I have the Amulet of the Scarab! Now I must return to High Priest Septa and give it to him.

s0: ^Let me rest a moment longer, King of Scarabs.
s1: ^You rouse me too soon, my Lord.
s2: ^We may travel together later, King Khepri

Mahef: ^We must part ways. Perhaps our paths will cross again. Leave me for now.
^We need of you, Mahef. Join me.
^Have you heard? This is a dark night, indeed.

s2: ^Any wise words for ahead of our journey this night?

Mahef: ^What a sight you are! Is something the matter?
^Rest now. I shall return this night. Farewell.

c-0: ^How dare you accuse me of betrayal!
^I who risk my soul transporting you to and from the Netherworld?!
^Find the real traitor, or I shall abandon your cause.
c-2: ^Of course! My spells are yours to use.
c-4: ^Indeed, we must speak. But make room for me in your party, so I may whisper my secrets.

s0: ^I have ensnared many freshly dead this day.
s1: ^ We have many corpses joining us in the Netherworld, my Lord.
s2: ^ The Netherworld is restless. Come prepared for this journey.
s3: ^ When the time comes for us to cross the rivers, bring an extra measure of might, my King.

s0: ^I have heard that many of our scarab siblings may not be what they seem.

c-7: ^We shall cross into the Netherworld later, my King

Mahef1.#: Lunu will suffer in darkness and the monsters of the Netherworld will invade the world of the living?

Mahef1: ^The servants of Apophis have stolen our sun?
^I fear so, Ferrybug. But worry not, together we will carve out their hearts and reclaim what is ours!
^It is true. And I weary of this dance. Today I abandon Lunu! I shall have my freedom while this land lingers in darkness.
Mahef2: ^I shall be your guide in the land of demons.
^We will reclaim the sun and overthrow Apophis! It will be a formidable battle indeed.
^One moment. I shall make room in my party.
^On second thought, what is the point of it all? I can simply leave this land and all its troubles...
Escape: ^You have failed the test, Khepri. For I knew your sun would be stolen.
^Yes. It was a test loyalty. The Sun God Ra wished it so.
^You could have been gifted with such power!
^But now, it is my duty to punish your duplicity. Prepare for battle!
^I tire of Lunu, it's scarabs and it's Netherworld. I have abandoned my people and will start anew elsewhere.
MahefParty: ^Lunu will tell tales of our victory for many moons to come!
global decl: ^Find a companion to join you on your journey!
